Companies listed on the Dar es Salaam Stock Exchange

contentMetadata.content:
{{Orphan|date=January 2016}} {{Infobox company | name = Tanzania Cigarette Public Limited Company | logo = | image = | image_caption = | type = [[Public limited company]] | traded_as = {{DARSE|TCC}} | parent = [[Japan Tobacco International]] | ISIN = TZ1996100032 | foundation = {{start date and age|1961}} | subsid = TCC (Kenya) Ltd. | location = Dar es salaam, Tanzania | area_served = Tanzania and Neighboring countries | key_people = Mr. Takashi Araki
(Chairman & CEO) | revenue = {{increase}} [[Tanzanian shilling|TSh ]]499.5 billion (2016) | operating_income ={{decrease}} TSh 95.3 billion (2016) | net_income ={{increase}} TSh 68.7 billion (2016) | industry = [[Tobacco]] | products = [[Cigarette]]s | homepage = [https://www.jti.com/africa/tanzania/ TCC PLC Profile] | num_employees = 445+{{cite web|title=Tanzania Cigarette Company Limited Summary|url=http://www.crmz.com/Report/ReportPreview.asp?BusinessId=9495919|website=Credit Risk Monitor|accessdate=23 July 2015}} }} '''Tanzania Cigarette Company Ltd.''' ("'''TCC'''"; [[Dar es Salaam Stock Exchange|DSE]]: TCC) is a tobacco company operating in [[Tanzania]]. The company started operations in 1961 as the East African Tobacco. Years later the government bought a large stake in the company and nationalized the company during the [[Ujamaa]] movement in 1975.{{Cite news|title = New Leaders Replace 'Big Men' As Privatization Sweeps Africa|url = https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB850172225786399500|newspaper = Wall Street Journal|access-date = 2016-02-14|issn = 0099-9660|first = Robert S.|last = Greenberger}}{{cite web|title=TCC â€“ Tanzania Cigarette Company|url=http://www.jti.com/our-company/where-we-operate/africa/tanzania/english/overview/|website=JTI|publisher=Japan Tobacco International|accessdate=23 July 2015}} TCC has been listed on the [[Dar es Salaam Stock Exchange]] since 16 November 2000. 75% of the company is owned by [[Japan Tobacco International]].{{cite web|title=Listed Companies|url=http://www.dse.co.tz/content/listed-companies|website=DSE-TZ|publisher=DSE|accessdate=23 July 2015|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150801110819/http://www.dse.co.tz/content/listed-companies|archivedate=1 August 2015}} ==History== ===Incorporation=== The Company was established as East African Tobacco in 1961. The factory was officially opened by [[Julius K. Nyerere|Mwalimu Julius K. Nyerere]] on December 4, 1961.{{cite web|title=TCC Annual Report 2014|url=http://dse.co.tz/sites/default/files/dsefiles/TCC_Annual_Report_2014_0.pdf|website=Dar-es-salaam Stock Exchange|accessdate=23 July 2015}} The Company now [[British American Tobacco|British American Tobacco (BAT)]] operated the company post-independence. In 1967, the [[government of Tanzania]] acquired a 60% stake in the company. During the socialist movement in Tanzania, in 1975 the government acquired the renaming 40% of the stake from the company and becomes the sole owner of the company. The company is renamed to Tanzania Cigarette Company ltd. ===Privatization=== After years of poor operation and management, the government sells 51% of its stake in the company to [[RJ Reynolds]] in 1995. As part of its purchase of some of the assets of RJ Reynolds in 1999, [[Japan Tobacco inc.|Japan Tobacco Inc.]] (JT) acquired a 51% interest in TCC. In September 2000, JT purchased an additional 24% of the shares through its international tobacco division, [[Japan Tobacco International]] (JTI), increasing its holdings to 75% of the shares.{{cite web|title=Company Overview of Tanzania Cigarette Company Limited|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=21989094|website=Bloomberg Business|publisher=Bloomberg|accessdate=23 July 2015}} ===Public offering=== Months after the acquisition of TCC by Japan Tobacco International, TCC was listed on the [[Dar es Salaam Stock Exchange|Dar Brouse]] with JTI still holding a 75% majority stake. ==Corporate affairs== TCC is the only producer of cigarettes in the country. In 2011 TCC brands conquer 90% of the Tanzanian market, while 5% is controlled by British American Tobacco whose factory is in neighboring Kenya, and 5% by foreign brands.{{cite web|title=Tanzania Tobacco Profile|url=http://who.int/tobacco/economics/tza.pdf|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029194211/http://www.who.int/tobacco/economics/tza.pdf|url-status=dead|archive-date=October 29, 2013|website=who.int|publisher=World Health Organization|accessdate=23 July 2015}} ===Ownership=== Tanzania Cigarette Company (TCC:DSE) is traded on the Stock Exchange since November 2000. Japan Tobacco International has held majority stake of 75% since September 2000.{{cite web|title=Tanzania Cigarette Company Limited (Exchange: DES Ticker: TCC)|url=http://www.africanselect.com/scripts/cgiip.wsc/tradeone/html/quote_and_news.r?pisharetype-id=13765|website=African Select|accessdate=23 July 2015}}
{{asof|December 2016}} the stock of TCC is owned by the following institutions: {| class="wikitable" style="margin:1em auto;" |- ! style="background: #00B88A; color:white;"| Shareholder ! style="background: #00B88A; color:white;"| Interest |- | [[Japan Tobacco International|JT International Holding B.V.]] | align=right|{{0}}75.0% |- | Kingsway Fund |align=right|{{0}}9.3% |- | General Public | align=right|{{0}}7.0% |- | Parastatal Pension Fund (PPF) | align=right|{{0}}3.0% |- | [[Government of Tanzania]] | align=right|{{0}}2.2% |- | Public Service Pension Fund (PSPF) | align=right|{{0}}1.0% |- | Others | align=right|{{0}}2.5% |- |} ===Business trends=== Below are the recent business trends for TCC. TCC financial year ends on 31 December. {| class="wikitable" style="margin:1em auto;" |- align="center" ! style="background: #00B88A;" | ! style="background: #00B88A; color:white;"| 2010 ! style="background: #00B88A; color:white;"| 2011 ! style="background: #00B88A; color:white;"| 2012 ! style="background: #00B88A; color:white;"| 2013 ! style="background: #00B88A; color:white;"| 2014 ! style="background: #00B88A; color:white;"| 2015 ! style="background: #00B88A; color:white;"| 2016 |- | Gross Turnover ([[Tanzanian shilling|TSh million]]) | align=center|321,777 | align=center|376,778 | align=center|422,594 | align=center|445,633 | align=center|461,720 | align=center|496,675 ! align=center|499,457 |- | Net Sales ([[Tanzanian shilling|TSh million]]) | align=center|211,008 | align=center|250,344 | align=center|281,419 | align=center|290,601 | align=center|283,910 | align=center|300,550 ! align=center|300,962 |- | Net Income ([[Tanzanian shilling|TSh million]]) | align=center|60,200 | align=center|70,942 | align=center|85,941 | align=center|78,058 | align=center|68,600 | align=center|65,711 ! align=center|68,669 |- | Debt Ratio (TL/TA) | align=center|27% | align=center|27% | align=center|27% | align=center|27% | align=center|28% | align=center|24% ! align=center|27% |- | Dividend per share ([[Tanzanian shilling|TSh]]) | align=center|{{shilingi|300}} | align=center|{{shilingi|600}} | align=center|{{shilingi|750}} | align=center|{{shilingi|750}} | align=center|{{shilingi|650}} | align=center|{{shilingi|600}} ! align=center|{{shilingi|600}} |- | ''Notes/sources'' | align=center| | align=center| | align=center| | align=center|{{cite news|title=TANZANIA CIGARETTE COMPANY LTD REPORTS A 9.2% DECLINE IN PROFIT|url=http://www.corporate-digest.com/index.php/tanzania-cigarette-company-ltd-reports-a-92-decline-in-profit|accessdate=23 July 2015|agency=Corporate Digest|date=18 March 2013}} | align=center|{{cite web|title=Tanzania Cigarette Company Overview|url=http://quotes.wsj.com/TZ/XDAR/TCC/financials|website=WSJ Quotes|publisher=Wall Street Journal|accessdate=23 July 2015}} | align=center|{{Cite web|url=http://dse.co.tz/sites/default/files/TCC-%20Annual%20Report%202016.pdf|title=TCC Annual Report 2016|last=|first=|date=|website=Dar es Salaam Stock Exchange|access-date=}} | align=center| |} ===Brands=== *'''Embassy''' - Registered in January, 1948 in [[Tanganyika (territory)|Tanganyika]] in the name of Brit-Am Tobacco (Tanzania) Limited. *'''Sweet Menthol (SM)''' - Launched in 1961 during incorporation. *'''Portsman''' - Formerly Sportsman *'''Club''' - Launched in 1998 *'''Safari''' - Launched in 2005 *'''[[Camel Cigarettes|Camel]]''' - Originally the American brand introduced in Tanzania by TCC. *'''Iceberg''' - Premium Menthol cigarette launched in 2008 ==See also== * [[Dar es Salaam Stock Exchange]] * [[Japan Tobacco International]] * [[British American Tobacco]] == References == {{Reflist|30em}} == External links == {{Portal bar|Tanzania|Companies|Africa}} {{Tanzania topics|state=collapsed}} {{Authority control}} [[Category:Manufacturing companies of Tanzania]] [[Category:Economy of Dar es Salaam]] [[Category:Manufacturing companies established in 1961]] [[Category:Companies listed on the Dar es Salaam Stock Exchange]] [[Category:1995 mergers and acquisitions]] [[Category:1999 mergers and acquisitions]] [[Category:1961 establishments in Tanganyika]]
contentMetadata.text: Tanzania Cigarette Company Ltd. ("TCC"; DSE: TCC) is a tobacco company operating in Tanzania. The company started operations in 1961 as the East African Tobacco. Years later the government bought a large stake in the company and nationalized the company during the Ujamaa movement in 1975. TCC has been listed on the Dar es Salaam Stock Exchange since 16 November 2000. 75% of the company is owned by Japan Tobacco International. The Company was established as East African Tobacco in 1961. The factory was officially opened by Mwalimu Julius K. Nyerere on December 4, 1961. The Company now British American Tobacco (BAT) operated the company post-independence. In 1967, the government of Tanzania acquired a 60% stake in the company. During the socialist movement in Tanzania, in 1975 the government acquired the renaming 40% of the stake from the company and becomes the sole owner of the company. The company is renamed to Tanzania Cigarette Company ltd. After years of poor operation and management, the government sells 51% of its stake in the company to RJ Reynolds in 1995. As part of its purchase of some of the assets of RJ Reynolds in 1999, Japan Tobacco Inc. (JT) acquired a 51% interest in TCC. In September 2000, JT purchased an additional 24% of the shares through its international tobacco division, Japan Tobacco International (JTI), increasing its holdings to 75% of the shares. Months after the acquisition of TCC by Japan Tobacco International, TCC was listed on the Dar Brouse with JTI still holding a 75% majority stake. TCC is the only producer of cigarettes in the country. In 2011 TCC brands conquer 90% of the Tanzanian market, while 5% is controlled by British American Tobacco whose factory is in neighboring Kenya, and 5% by foreign brands. Tanzania Cigarette Company (TCC:DSE) is traded on the Stock Exchange since November 2000. Japan Tobacco International has held majority stake of 75% since September 2000. As of December 2016[update] the stock of TCC is owned by the following institutions: Below are the recent business trends for TCC. TCC financial year ends on 31 December. Embassy - Registered in January, 1948 in Tanganyika in the name of Brit-Am Tobacco (Tanzania) Limited. Sweet Menthol (SM) - Launched in 1961 during incorporation. Portsman - Formerly Sportsman Club - Launched in 1998 Safari - Launched in 2005 Camel - Originally the American brand introduced in Tanzania by TCC. Iceberg - Premium Menthol cigarette launched in 2008 Dar es Salaam Stock Exchange Japan Tobacco International British American Tobacco "Tanzania Cigarette Company Limited Summary". Credit Risk Monitor. Retrieved 23 July 2015. Greenberger, Robert S. "New Leaders Replace 'Big Men' As Privatization Sweeps Africa". Wall Street Journal. ISSNÂ 0099-9660. Retrieved 2016-02-14. "TCC â€“ Tanzania Cigarette Company". JTI. Japan Tobacco International. Retrieved 23 July 2015. "Listed Companies". DSE-TZ. DSE. Archived from the original on 1 August 2015. Retrieved 23 July 2015. "TCC Annual Report 2014" (PDF). Dar-es-salaam Stock Exchange. Retrieved 23 July 2015. "Company Overview of Tanzania Cigarette Company Limited". Bloomberg Business. Bloomberg. Retrieved 23 July 2015. "Tanzania Tobacco Profile" (PDF). who.int. World Health Organization. Archived from the original (PDF) on October 29, 2013. Retrieved 23 July 2015. "Tanzania Cigarette Company Limited (Exchange: DES Ticker: TCC)". African Select. Retrieved 23 July 2015. "TANZANIA CIGARETTE COMPANY LTD REPORTS A 9.2% DECLINE IN PROFIT". Corporate Digest. 18 March 2013. Retrieved 23 July 2015. "Tanzania Cigarette Company Overview". WSJ Quotes. Wall Street Journal. Retrieved 23 July 2015. "TCC Annual Report 2016" (PDF). Years later the government bought a large stake in the company and nationalized the company during the [[Ujamaa]] movement in 1975.{{Cite news|title = New Leaders Replace 'Big Men' As Privatization Sweeps Africa|url = https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB850172225786399500|newspaper = Wall Street Journal|access-date = 2016-02-14|issn = 0099-9660|first = Robert S.|last = Greenberger}}{{cite web|title=TCC â€“ Tanzania Cigarette Company|url=http://www.jti.com/our-company/where-we-operate/africa/tanzania/english/overview/|website=JTI|publisher=Japan Tobacco International|accessdate=23 July 2015}} TCC has been listed on the [[Dar es Salaam Stock Exchange]] since 16 November 2000. 75% of the company is owned by [[Japan Tobacco International]].{{cite web|title=Listed Companies|url=http://www.dse.co.tz/content/listed-companies|website=DSE-TZ|publisher=DSE|accessdate=23 July 2015|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150801110819/http://www.dse.co.tz/content/listed-companies|archivedate=1 August 2015}}

texts.title: Incorporation
texts.value: The Company was established as East African Tobacco in 1961.<ref name="jti_profile"/> The factory was officially opened by [[Julius K. Nyerere|Mwalimu Julius K. Nyerere]] on December 4, 1961.<ref name=ann_2014>{{cite web|title=TCC Annual Report 2014|url=http://dse.co.tz/sites/default/files/dsefiles/TCC_Annual_Report_2014_0.pdf|website=Dar-es-salaam Stock Exchange|accessdate=23 July 2015}}</ref> The Company now [[British American Tobacco|British American Tobacco (BAT)]] operated the company post-independence. In 1967, the [[government of Tanzania]] acquired a 60% stake in the company. During the socialist movement in Tanzania, in 1975 the government acquired the renaming 40% of the stake from the company and becomes the sole owner of the company. The company is renamed to Tanzania Cigarette Company ltd.<ref name="ann_2014"/>

texts.title: Privatization
texts.value: After years of poor operation and management, the government sells 51% of its stake in the company to [[RJ Reynolds]] in 1995. As part of its purchase of some of the assets of RJ Reynolds in 1999, [[Japan Tobacco inc.|Japan Tobacco Inc.]] (JT) acquired a 51% interest in TCC. In September 2000, JT purchased an additional 24% of the shares through its international tobacco division, [[Japan Tobacco International]] (JTI), increasing its holdings to 75% of the shares.<ref name="jti_profile"/><ref name=bloomb>{{cite web|title=Company Overview of Tanzania Cigarette Company Limited|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=21989094|website=Bloomberg Business|publisher=Bloomberg|accessdate=23 July 2015}}</ref>

texts.title: Public offering
texts.value: Months after the acquisition of TCC by Japan Tobacco International, TCC was listed on the [[Dar es Salaam Stock Exchange|Dar Brouse]] with JTI still holding a 75% majority stake.

texts.title: Corporate affairs
texts.value: TCC is the only producer of cigarettes in the country. In 2011 TCC brands conquer 90% of the Tanzanian market, while 5% is controlled by British American Tobacco whose factory is in neighboring Kenya, and 5% by foreign brands.<ref name=who_prof>{{cite web|title=Tanzania Tobacco Profile|url=http://who.int/tobacco/economics/tza.pdf|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029194211/http://www.who.int/tobacco/economics/tza.pdf|url-status=dead|archive-date=October 29, 2013|website=who.int|publisher=World Health Organization|accessdate=23 July 2015}}</ref>

texts.title: Ownership
texts.value:
Tanzania Cigarette Company (TCC:DSE) is traded on the Stock Exchange since November 2000. Japan Tobacco International has held majority stake of 75% since September 2000.{{cite web|title=Tanzania Cigarette Company Limited (Exchange: DES Ticker: TCC)|url=http://www.africanselect.com/scripts/cgiip.wsc/tradeone/html/quote_and_news.r?pisharetype-id=13765|website=African Select|accessdate=23 July 2015}}

texts.title: Business trends
texts.value: Below are the recent business trends for TCC. TCC financial year ends on 31 December.
